Reviews.Title: “STOP!!! Don't Book It! Awful Service and horrible, tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Dharam C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The alarm bells started to ring in my head upon check-in when I was asked to pay the full amount of our stay in advance, which is quite unusual. When I asked to first see the Double Studio room that I had booked in advance, my request was denied and was told that it was company policy to first complete the payment. I had a bad feeling about this place and if I hadn’t arrived late that evening at around 11pm, I would have gone elsewhere. On seeing my room, I realised that my fears had been justified! I was shocked and disappointed to discover that my Double Studio apartment was actually a tiny room with some kitchen appliance built into a wardrobe. To make things worse, the TV and phone did not work at all and there was a horrible stench of sewage coming into the room. Despite raising my issues with the receptionist/ manager, nothing was done to resolve the situation since they had already been paid for the entire stay. I was promised that I would be moved to another room but on the next day the manager did not seem to care and no action was taken. I repeat, DO NOT STAY HERE! It is the by far the worst place I have ever stayed in London. This was a terrible experience so avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “A disgusting place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: snakeflow
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this place. My photos tells it all and there is no manager to talk with to try to solve something. I TOTALLY DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking apartment!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rusty K
Reviews.Content: I waste 9 days of my life in this horrible apartment. Stay away from Dylan Earls Court Apartments. It was awful experience in a very small dirty room and rude staff in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Not much better than a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: but without the communal room Our room looked nothing like the marketing photographs. We stayed at the Philbeach Gardens, Earls Court. The photos are NOT accurate. You can do better than this even in London for this price range. 1. Do not sign up for an extended stay (more than three days per the hotel rules). We wanted to leave after 8 days of our 13 day stay, but we had paid for the full stay in advance, and the clerk pointed out the policy posted on the wall in the lobby: no refunds for extended stay. Pay a day at a time if you insist on staying here. There were plenty of open rooms. 2. Even for a discount rate in London, this one is not worth the money. Our room was 10 x 10 feet at most. The bed took up the bulk of the floor space. Upon entry, the room smelt of sewer fumes. The kitchenette took up the rest ... at least it worked. 3. The quality of the room renovation was poor. Paint job was sloppy. The furniture was real cheap and worn. 4. The tiling on the bathroom walls were cracked, and the shower handle fell off. Two of the lights did not work. The halls were noisy because of the wood floors. Other guests were noisy. The windows did not in the least keep out any of the street noise. Bring your earplugs! 5. A room down the hall was being worked on, and so we had to put up with paint fumes too--the floor was being refinished. Wish we would have checked Trip Advisor first.

Reviews.Title: “Earls Court Appts”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxxxxxxx x
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during November 2010. I was given the 'Best room' on the top floor for which I paid top $ for. It was a dump. in fact It was so bad it was funny. Bearing in mind it was November - we arrived to find the windows wide opened. This was because the heating was unable to be turned off. the room was on the Earls Court road, so our choice was either road noise or heat stroke. There was no TV remote - as apparently the previous occupier had run off with it!. So we were advised to climb on a chair to reach the TV controls on top of the wall mounted TV. The shower was amazing - no idea you could get that many cracks in tiles and the novelty toilet seat [it was not attached so kept falling off] was fun too. But I think the highlight of our stay was the bed collapsing at 3 am. It is a cheap bed with removable wooden struts under the mattress - which when you moved - came out. Needless to say I asked for the manager - who apparently does not actually exist - so I was given a phone number to call the day after I left. As of course you have to pre pay - the attitude of the 'management' appeared to be ' we have your money, so we dont care how good /bad your stay was' Interesting experience and if you want an urban endurance course experience or are possessed with a masochistic streak - this is certainly the place for you. If however, you a merely a human being with some awareness of hygene and basic comfort - then I would advise you avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “If only id checked Tripadvisor 1st - What a dump”
Reviews.Author: chris v
Reviews.Content: All I can say is what a disappointment!, paid 130,00 for x1 night of misery. Stayed in the basement of this building in an "apartment" ...more like a cupboard with a bed, entered the room to find the pleasant smell of raw sewage after spending 5 minutes in the room realised we were above the tube line and every 10minutes (all night) had to deal with the room shaking and noise of underground trains. Asked reception if we could change .. denied any knowledge of our room being effected by this noise, asked for refund, staff totally refused was then offered an upgrade for an additional min price of 250.00 which I declined. Real shoddy standard of room holes in walls broken plasterboard etc utter sham, the only positive I can take away from this experience is the next time I book a hotel will defiantly do my research 1st!! Steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “Not like website”
Reviews.Author: CB_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: Booked this before reading tripadvisor. First of all the photos on the website are of the "delux" room not the standard type rooms you will get. We had booked a double room and when we arrived our first room was a twin which stank of either water damage or urine. On asking for another room we were told that the room we had originally booked still had the previous guest in it who hadn't checked out and they "couldn't move his stuff". We were given a temporary room, still a twin, the paint was chipped, the toilet door was held together with duct tape and they had a shower curtain over the windows in the room! We eventually got our final room the next day which was satisfactory. On checking out we asked if we could leave our bags and they said that we could leave them for a couple of hours, after the 2 hours it would be Â£10 per room to leave bags. The apartment part of the room is a sink, microwave and one hob and a fridge contained in a tiny small cupboard area. So, whilst relatively cheap the service is poor, the rooms are poor and I wouldn't stay here again. The place has a lot of potential but unfortunately doesn't come up to scratch!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out - They are scamming customers”
Reviews.Author: Neve1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel only to be told that we had been transferred to another Dylan Hotel as they were fully booked, the alternative being apparently only two minutes away, with no explanation or apology, although we had booked well in advance. After a 10 minute walk with all our suitcases we arrived to a scruffy, filthy alternative. We refused to stay and was met with indifference by the receptionist. Furious, we demanded that they honour our original booking back at Earls Court. We was told that we could stay in another place across the road, but had to pay another Â£125.00 more! Refusing to pay the extra we asked to speak to the Management. Amazingly we was told that the Manager was in a meeting (5pm on a SATURDAY NIGHT) and would not speak to us! So we got our suitcases and walked back to Earls Court to speak to the Management in Person. We was met by a Receptionist who initially wouldn't get the Manager but eventually someone can out to us, got some keys and showed us two rooms (amazing as we was told that they were fully booked). Not one word of sorry for the terrible experience we had suffered. We stayed the night as we could got find an alternative for the evening at such short notice. Be warned that the building is dangerous, exposed electrical wires and inadequate fire precautions. Terrible, terrrible place. In a nutshell - The scam is to pretend Hotel is fully booked, show you a filthy alternative, try to squeeze more money from you by showing you somewhere clean but for double the original price quoted. They pray on tired, weary travellers, who think it is too late to find an alternative hotel at such short notice and just pay up! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: This place has no resemblance to the website. Think dodgy bedsit rather than modern apartment. We'd booked a triple room but were not given this - however, we were refused a refund. The flat screen tv was a tiny portable and power shower was a hose over the bath (no place to attach it to the wall). Staff very unhelpful. I have never written a review before but feel compelled to warn others about this place.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE STAY OUT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jussi h
Reviews.Content: The room was given from basement. There was broken lights on the corridor so you could not see all the time when walking to the room. Room was in mould because of heavy water damages. Fire alarm was missing from the room. There was insect traps everywhere. Disgusting place, unpolite personnel who refused to return the money. Did not stay there went to Bayswater area.

Reviews.Title: “tiny , well equipped”
Reviews.Author: hempadan
Reviews.Content: I took a single. Very tiny , typical for a 3 star hotel...I was surprised to find a fully equipped kitchenette, iron ,hair dryer ,etc. If you have a short stay it is ok ...

Reviews.Title: “Terribly misrepresented hotel”
Reviews.Author: viri
Reviews.Content: First of all the sign on the hotel was different. I had to go in and check. I had a double studio room. What ever the hell that is supposed to mean. In actuality, it was a small room, with a kitchenette against the wall. A small room is NOT a studio apt. I made this clear to the front desk staff. They didn't seem a bit surprised by my complaint. I got the impression that they had heard it before. They offered me a bigger room on the ground floor closer to the reception desk. I didn't really want to be that close to the reception. I simply left a day early and took the loss - going to another hotel. At first I couldn't understand why a "double studio apartment" was going so cheap. Now I do. At least it was close to the tube station. V

Reviews.Title: “STOP!!! Don't Book It....”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: I cannot express how horrific on every level possible this hellhole is.. Our room was the most disgusting space I have ever been offered to sleep in and the running of the premises appalling. Do I need to say we walked away losing all our money and having to pay for another hotel. Be warned! Do not sign ANYTHING or give credit card details until you have seen your room. I agree fully that this monstrosity needs closing down, NOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Gustav F
Reviews.Content: Well, the first room we got was terrible, nothing like the pictures on their website...more like a dirty w****house, we wouldnt stay there for anything in the world. when we said we wanted our money back weÂ´ve got a new "deluxe" room, it was alot better but...first impression lasts!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!! WORST PLACE EVER - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megan B
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe this accommodation. It is the by far the worst place I have ever stayed in and I have back packed through India! The bed linen was dirty, the carpet completely stained. The bathroom was filthy and covered with hair. The shower didnt even work!!!! The floor was littered with dead moths. One night some poor customers were waiting and waiting for reception which was closed - they had to wait in the rain for someone to show them their room despite the hotel claiming 24/7 reception. It is impossible to sleep as the room in like an oven and the beds/pillows are AWFUL. We woke to the horrible smell of off curry. Dylans apartments claim to be studios - if that was a kitchen then my wardrobe could also offer accommodation to poor unsuspecting customers. My advice would be DO NOT STAY HERE it will ruin your London experience. Look around Earls Court there are plenty more places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a couple, but NO NO for more than 2”
Reviews.Author: amirsalleh
Reviews.Content: The room was not as bad as some of the reviews I've read. However, it was not awesome either. Staff were friendly enough, and the room was clean. It did appear half done though! And basic items like free coffee were not provided. I think for a couple the room was spacious enough. But add a kid (or more) and you are in for a disaster. Location wise: 5 star! I cant really decide at the end of the day whether I enjoyed myself in this hotel, but maybe the answer lies here: If given a second chance, and with the same amount of money, I think I would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid by all means! Daylight robbery, should be closed down with the owner”
Reviews.Author: rastapastaman
Reviews.Content: We ran into major sanitary and safety problems at Dylan Earls Court Hotel (btw it's not an apartment or a hotel, more like a rathole) booked through a website agent (who will hopefully remove this property from their site by the time this review is published :))). Upon check-in we were requested to pay the full amount of our stay in advance (quite unusual, travelled around the world never experienced such terms and conditions, hah); without the full advance payment we were denied to see our room (or any rooms for that matter) and to our query were told this is their Company Policy. It may start to shine on you at this point already that such precondition is part of their PAY or get 'stuck' scheme as the website agent already reserved Å�100 on my bank account to secure our online booking. Hey, the studio apartments are about 2x2.5 meters, so it's either you stand or lie in bed - no running around, and my son has a single bed the size of these ridiculous 'doubles' :))) Later in the evening after our ungracious check-in (remind you: after the full advance payment of 4 nights!) we ran into some sanitary and health problems (broken tiles, broken shower plexy glass, broken metal hangers in the shower room, mildew, etc) which we immediately reported at the reception and asked for another room. We were offered an 'upgrade' at Å�80 surcharge and shown a decent (but still miniscule) room which we denied claiming we booked a superior room in the booking system where there no 'luxury room' options - only rooms at fixed prices. Next morning after a refreshing sleep in the 'mini double bed' (140x190 dubbed a double?) massaged by broken springs in the matress we were greeted by the happy bedbugs. I didn't miss out the chance to give one little guy 15 minutes fame on camera prior to final termination. This really had us going and we were ready to move out immediately. We offered the receptionist an amicable solution with them granting us a refund and us leaving in peace (i.e. forgetting all the nuances of our stay and not following-up on the story). We were confronted with ignorance and absolute denial by an obnoxious receptionist (the same one who claimed their company policy is to show our room only upon full payment). I asked to talk to the manager and was told she is not on the premises, I also was denied any contact to the property manager/owner (name or contact telephone number). Hey, she was the invisible woman with no mobile number in the 21st century! We checked-out nevertheless and agreed to come back at 1.00 PM to meet the manager and discuss the issue. We returned at 1.00 PM - of course no manager was around - and were told that the manager will not be on the premises that day. We were again denied any assistance and contact to the hotel management. At this point asking for a full refund and/or invoice we were denied both by the receptionist. As we checked into another hotel by then (of course not into a free room) I made an official complaint at the police as we were not given any invoice OR refund - I was there with my pants down - who knows what lies could have followed if we don't record the issue. Further to this - following some helpful legal advise - I have made an official complaint at the Health Department of the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea. These were needed for the records to avoid any future lies by the Hotel. Eventually we got an invoice from the hotel 2 days after (!) after our check-out only with the direct assistance and presence of a helpful Borough policeman. No refund was paid by Dylan Earls Court, meaning we are short of GBP 360, not to mention all the stress and ordeal as you can imagine. I tag this situation DAYLIGHT ROBBERY and strongly urge you anyone to steer clear of this 'Hotel'. I've got great vid of the happy bedbug but seems I can only post pocs here...oh well Happy travels everyone, don't run into ratholes like these! And a big hello to Mrs Abdullah!!! We managed to track her down, she is running the place - u know, she is the invisible woman :)))

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: RSR_11
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 studios together for family (us and elderly parents) and got them 2 floors apart (with the receptionist admitting that she was aware we booked for them together but cudnt accommodate it!). Both the studios were MINISCULE with the one in the basement which had broken, noisy bed springs and a smelly drainage outside. We had booked for 2 nights and after the first sleepless one, we complained to the receptionist. After speaking twice in the morning before leaving for the day, we called again towards the evening to check if any room change had been made and they said that it wasn't possible as they believed the room to be in good condition. It was only after another tirade from us with the insistence that they test the room that they agreed to check for options. we finally managed to get another studio for the second night which was even smaller (believe it or not!) but at least had the basic hygiene factors taken care of. For a 3 star you expect at least a basic comfort room and no luxury, this place is more like a 1 or 2 star (at a stretch!)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: alexitos
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights with a friend and was horrible. It looked ok outside but once we got in our room it looked disgusting. Dampness in all the room, tiny kitchen and worse toilet. The staff in the reception are used to hear complaints, they tell you the manager is not available and dont even try solving the problem. They make you pay in advance before seing the room because they know most customers complain. Wifi too expensive and once we paid it it didnt work properly. Please AVOID going to this DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! I wish I could give it a minus rating.”
Reviews.Author: Schmikey
Reviews.Content: I wish my Administrator had checked out Tripadvisor before she booked me into this dive. Everything everyone else has criticised about this place is true: it is a complete rip off it is not a hotel it is not an apartment. I've had my pets stay in better places than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: sfendt
Reviews.Content: The location for a trade-show at the Earls Court convention center, and London Underground station was great. The ad said "Free WiFi" - which was NOT free - in fact if it was working (which it did not for the entire 6 night stay), it would have been 10 GBP/day. In my room I was actually able to get a BT-FON hot-spot down the road ro 15 GBP for 5 pk of 24 hour passes which lasted my entire stay. The room was clean, the bed was a decent bed. The term "cozy" comes to mind given the size of even a double room. There were a few channels on the TV that worked. It did have a "kitchenette" and fridge (one cabinet included all) and it was clean and usable. The one pot, one pan were fine, the two lids fit neither, and a set of unmatched coffee cups - but I wasn't too picky. The shower was plumed awkward (so you can't set the temperature before getting in), but hot water was always available. Not the quietest place, but that could have been my room next to the elevator. Not bad for a budget place. The fine print does warn about the up-front payment and 5% fee for using a non-UK card before you get there (10% if you use AMEX). Next time; I think I'm going for a chain - probably worth the few $ extra.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A SCAM!!! DO NOT BOOK!!!”
Reviews.Author: shawblades
Reviews.Content: Dylan Apartments is a scam. Do not stay here. First, this is not an apartment, its small hotel rooms with beds crammed in and a small cabinet kitchenette which is unusable. The TV and furniture are extremely old and abused. Second, the room is infested with bugs. Ants and some unrecognizable ones. I reported all of this to the reception and they didn't care. I asked to speak to the manager, and they said I can't, that the manager doesn't speak to customers! I've never heard of such a policy. The manager obviously avoids customers because they know they are scamming the customers. This place is not a backpacker's hotel where you can expect problems. They price themselves as a 4 star hotel!!! No refund, no customer service policy. I called the health inspector on them, hopefully something can happen. The ceiling and floor are water damaged, and the door frame is separated from the wall, so locking it doesn't do any good. I felt very unsafe here. Finally when we checked in the reception said that all non-UK credit cards are subject to a 5% surcharge. The reception forgot to add that to our charge (you have to pre-pay in full). 30 minutes after we checked in the reception came to our room with tears in her eyes that she needs to ask to add the 5% to our credit card or the manager will take the mistake out of her salary. She was completely frightened. I can't imagine what other verbal abuse the poor reception must have faced in the past to be in tears when coming to explain something like this to a customer. I wish there was a Better Business Bureau in London for me to report this place to. It should be closed down! Do not be fooled, it is a scam.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here: you have been forewarned.”
Reviews.Author: barnowl60
Reviews.Content: I had booked through great-london-hotels.com for Dylan House. Upon calling to confirm the reservation, I was informed the location was changed to their "newly acquired" property near Earls Court. Not as convenient, but ok. If it was a new property, I assumed it would be comparable to the Dylan House location I had originally booked with. We arrived at Philbeach Court location, and curousily were told we were at the wrong location, that we were booked for another property. Granted we were a bit tired after a day of travel, and didn't want to cross the city late at night to chase down the right hotel booking, so I asked if she could please see if we could stay here. With a deep sigh, a room was found. We needed to pay up front, for three nights, cash only. The 3 weary travellors then went up to room 27. I'll have to say that honestly, the room was beyond unacceptable. My husband is a simple Missouri man, and doesn't get too fussed about things; but even this caught him off guard. The bathroom is perched up two filthy, carpeted stairs, and the "door" to the bathroom is a bifold closet door! So, when you are inside, it can't be opened of course, since closet bifold doors are not designed to be operated from the inside... As expected, the bathroom is small, but I've never seen one this small. The toilet shifted as did the sink whenever used -- as if they were not installed properly. The "kitchenette" is a small cabinet, and awkward for even the simplist of tasks (like hot water). The walls had not been painted in some time, as evidenced by scrapes, dents, smudges and various unsavory splotches of unknown origin. There was an exposed nail on one of the steps leading up to the bathroom(wear shoes!); the light switches had a grubby sticky look. One generally got the feeling this was not a respectable hotel. Now, I will have to inform you one thing the room did have going for it :clean sheets and towels. Thin, a bit thread worn, but clean. What a relief! HAD the room been comfortably under 100 pounds per night, I might not have too much to complain about. London is a very expensive city. But, we paid 130 pounds a night (or about $210). One thing that would have turned things around was some effort on the part of Dylan Properties to care about our experience. We had requested to check out a night early. We could indeed leave early, but without any any sort of refund, partial, minimal, or otherwise. And that, ladies and gentlemen, was the full extent of the front desk "customer service". No one even asked if if we wanted a different room; or if there was something they could do to make our stay more comfortable, etc. We went to a few hotels right in the neighborhood to see if it was just us, or were all hotels like this? We found the Mayflower Hotel, one block up, for an additional 30 GBP a night, and booked that for our last (4th)night. This hotel is AMAZING: the room had a full kitchen, tastefully and well thought out furnishings, and breakfast is included! After returning home (we are from Seattle, but living in Germany for a short spell), I spent some time communicating with the booking agency to relate our experience and concerns. I was told twice, over a period of 3 weeks, that "they were working on it","so sorry your experience was not good" etc etc. I even suggested a couple of things they could offer to make up for our experience: vouchers for future trip; refund one night; anything. To date I have not heard back a word. Emails to the addresses listed on the Dylan house website have been returned as undeliverable. If this review is helpful please indicate. I'm sure our experience is not normal for London hotels over 130GBP per night; but your best bet is to stick with recommended hotels from guides, such as Rick Steves.

Reviews.Title: “On the Positive Side our rooms had several walls without Cracks...”
Reviews.Author: DylanSurvivor
Reviews.Content: At the Dylan Court you could be treated to... A run down room...actually that's being too kind - everything needs renovating from scratch. A wardrobe with a sink in it (See image). Key cards which won't let you in the building. No manager in sight - therefore nobody to complain to. Bathroom fittings which look like they've been installed by a child with a glue gun. Stained carpets. A shower which has no water pressure and random blasts of hot water...luckily, they've thought ahead and broken the shower door for easy escape and avoidance of 3rd degree burns. Nice view of scaffolding outside the window. Staff which have no clue how to use the booking system - we actually felt sorry for the receptionist who had been left to deal with everything on her first day. Payment up front, so without any managers around - refunds are nigh on impossible. Finally, I don't know where the pictures came from on the website - but these are a million miles away from the real living conditions. Worst apartment / hotel with a wardrobe sink - I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: jolly7
Reviews.Content: For the first time - I would prefer to give a zero rating to this establishment. The web site is highly misleading. As a solo business traveller I look for cleanliness, security and location. This may have met the location requirement but that was all. The "superior" studio was dirty; the room stank of damp or sewage; the ground floor window had a curtain which did left the bottom 12 inches uncovered so no privacy; immediately outside the window (which did not close properly) were empty cans of beer. when I spoke to reception no defence or offer of assistance was given. The place is shocking. I checked in and within the hour I checked out. Fortunately I was able to find alternative accommodation but this meant additional charges. We have since contacted this dreadful place for its company details to enable us to write a letter of formal complaint and the personnel refused to provide this information. Stay away!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If this was a delux room I wouln't like to see a basic room.”
Reviews.Author: Lisnagarveylass
Reviews.Content: There is a 5 0/0 charge for a credit card and 10 0/0 for American Express. I was asked for my card number and the cvc number on the back of the card. I refused to give these details. I was also asked for ID and they photocopied my driving lisence. I had booked a delux single room. It was in the basement and smelt of damp. The plaster was cracked and peeling with damp. There was a flat screen tv in the bathroom but no heat, shaver point or hair dryer. There was a large gap under the door. Although there was a radiator in the bedroom there was also an electric heater which was needed to heat the room. It didn't have a safety label attached so I assumed it hadn't been tested by an electrician. This goes against all health and safety regulations.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID”
Reviews.Author: sellis1313
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at these apartments. If I could give a zero for this hotel I would. When we first arrived we were told we had to pay a Â£250 security deposit. Considering we were only staying for one night and paid Â£65 for the room this was absolutely disgusting. We had no prior notice of this and we booked through their offical website. Our room was number 6 in the 'basement' well enough said. When my boyfriend sat on the bed he slid off because 2 or 3 slats were missing in the bed, there was paint missing all over the walls and holes in the walls above your pillow. The bathroom was tiny - the only way two of you could stand in there was if one was in the shower! The heating/aircon system was just on hot - so hot that in the middle of winter we had to open the window. It was so so terrible I can not tell you enough to not stay here. We went and complained and got moved to a different room that was only slightly better - the sinks however completely stank and when we ran a tap we almost wanted to be sick. When we checked out we asked if we could leave our bags as our train wasn't for a few hours. We were told yes but it was Â£10 per room to leave the bags. We paid it and our bags were just left at the reception desk next to the vending machine - not even locked up!! Please take our word for it - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this property”
Reviews.Author: asbedi
Reviews.Content: I had a booking for five days at this location. Here is my overview: 1. The booking process was fairly easy at the website. THE WARNING: The site owners mention that this is NOT their website. It supposedly belongs to some company called Adverstising On Line (AOL). Hence changes to the reservation cannot be made onsite - any changes made are not honoured. In short, even though the website carries their brand, they do not honour their commitment 2. Check In : Fairly smooth process. You have to pay the entire amount up front. Read the contract carfully!!! 3. Rooms : I had got the standard double room. The photographs on the site are not at all representative of the room. The room is dilapidated and is smaller than you could imagine. The linen is old. There are broken appliances lying in the room. Another point - Wi-FI is not included in the room rate, though there is no mention of a charge on the website. One look at the room and a smell of the place and I wanted to check out. 4. Customer Service : I confirmed with the desk when i could check out from the site without a penalty. The contract signed says that anything over three days is a long term stay. However, the gentleman at the reception assured me that i could check out after 48 hours without a penalty. I made alternate bookings based on this. However, when i went to check out, the hotel manager refused to honour that commitment. They said the employee was new and there was no refund for the two extra days (that were committed to me) since it was mentioned in the sign-in contract. Further, since i did not book directly with them(there is no webiste for this), they could not change the reservation. In short, they have stolen GBP 150 from me as a result of this. Please avoid this location - the management is dishonest. 5. Location : The property is well located on Warwick road in Earl's court and a short walk from Kensington High Street. Be warned, however, that it is on a busy street and you will hear traffic all night and all day. 6. Other : There is a penalty of GBP 50 for not returning the key - be very careful about this if you are still adventurous and decide to stay at this site. This is an absurd charge and something you need to be cognizant of. I STRONGLY URGE YOU TO AVOID THIS PROPERTY.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: josh-491
Reviews.Content: We are from Italy and I was staying with my friend for couple of days in November In this hotel . The hotel is good located but for the price that we paid for this hotel we could get something much more better then that . They also took deposit 250.00 that it wasnt mension on their website. The only good thing was lady on the reception very helpful and nice. THIS HOTEL IS NOT THE PLACE THAT WE WANT TO COME BACK.

Reviews.Title: “I have never experienced such squalor!”
Reviews.Author: mat_huddersfield
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say... This place should be shut down!! My partner and I were due to stay here for two nights over a weekend in November. It cost Â£160 for both nights which we thought was a good deal for how spectacular the apartments looked on the online pictures on booking.com (who we booked thorugh). The room we were given was no more than a box. The curtain was so short it didn't reach to the bottom of the window, so what did they do to solve the problem?? Well they unpicked the hem to make it longer, however this still did not work. Why did they not replace it? The builders outside could see us getting changed and showered! The kitchette consisted on a very small cupboard with a microwave, kettle, hotplate and sink. This very small space was a massive fire hassard! There was a sign explaining how to use a fire blanket but no sign of a fire blanket or extinguisher in sight!! The bath had the taps at one end and the plug/overflow pipe at the other. Exactly how was I supposed to take a bath?? Impossible!! The Bath panel was made of plywood. The door into the bathroom was broken (see picture) so you had to watch each other on the toilet and in the bathroom! Worst of all the bed collapsed whilst we were asleep in the early hours of the morning! And I mean totally collapsed. I have attached picture of this which shows that this bed has been obviously broken quite some time as the metal and wood underneath had been bent and in some places snapped completely at various points. We tried to call the concierge but our phone didn't work. The following morning the receptionist first of all refused to give us a refund and refused to call the manager. He stated that he was the only person there and he couldn't contact the manager. 35 minutes after I had insisted that he contact the manager, she turned up to see me. She did refund me for the full weekend however was not very appologetic and in fact was rather more bothered about making excuses for the complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be conned !!!”
Reviews.Author: Mossiver
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay in the Dylan Earls Court apartments, AKA the York Hotel whilst on a recent business trip to London. Booked through an agency based in the UK, this establishment is without doubt the worst standard of accommodation that I have ever experienced worldwide!!! The room was nothing short of a tenement. Dirty carpets, wires hanging form walls and ceilings, a smell of refuse and not big enough to move in. Upon check in they also insist on a security deposit of Â£250 and charge an additional 5% in your credit card is issued in the Euro Zone!! Beware the web site pictures are a CON! The rooms are nothing like this.

Reviews.Title: “Small, terrible!”
Reviews.Author: evele
Reviews.Content: We were very, very dissapointed! Smallest room ever, kitchnette almost useless. Expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Elena M.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled all over the world with the exception of the Orient and this is the worst room for the highest price that we have ever rented. The fire alarm was disconnected, the telephone didn't work, the drain in the bathroom didn't work, the room smelled reminiscent of a sewer, the price for internet was absolutely ridiculous even though the manager and desk clerk knew the phone wasn't working and this was the only way I could communicate and the price to leave baggage after checkout was astronomical. One day when it was pouring rain outside it was also pouring down the wall inside our room, which explained why the picture on the wall was moldy. The pictures on their website show updated rooms but we had a closet in the basement. There were french doors to outside with a view of a concrete wall but because the security bars were very low we couldn't even leave the doors open at night for air. One day our room wasn't cleaned and all our towels were sodden since we had to use them to mop up the bathroom floor. When I mentioned it to the manager he asked if we had requested a cleaning and change of towels, saying it was necessary to do so - although both had been done the day before without being requested. We did not experience rudeness from any of the staff - all conversations were civil but there were only 2 people there who seemed to care. The attitude of the others was as if they couldn't have cared less. I would never, ever stay there again and urge anyone considering it to look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities ok (just) but staff not at all helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hendo_David
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed at York house with her mother for 4 nights. I needed to contact her but both times I called I was told that it was not possible to be put through to the room. She also tried to call while she was there but the phone in the room was not working, despite the web site saying there were direct-dial phones in the rooms. I left 2 messages for her which reception said they would pass on but she didn't receive either. I also sent a fax to her care of the hotel fax number but she did not receive that either. All except for one staff member were particularly UNhelpful, offering no advice or help whatsover when asked. The room iteself was ok, although lights were not working when they first arrived. and there was no plug for the sink which made it difficult to do the dishes. There was also no tea-towel until the last day when one was provided. Cooking facilities consisted of a hotplate and microwave in a cupboard. Although this was adequate, there were no instructions on use of the microwave and it took my wife a while to work it out that she also had to turn on a seperate timer switch. My wife paid cash, but the 5% surcharge on credit cards (10% on Amex) seems quite excessive, as does the charge to leave your bags before/after you check in/out.. The internet in the hotel was akso prohibatively expensive.. Location is quite good, but we would definitely not choose to stay at York House again. There was one particularly helpful staff memeber, but she was only on for one shift during my wifes stay, and the other staff were positively unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: Spoils
Reviews.Content: Didn't start well when we were snipped 10 pounds to leave our bags on the foyer floor for 3 hours, then they advised there was a 5% surcharge when paying by credit for the whole stay. Room was clean and modern enough however it was tiny, not like the pictures would have you believe. The bed was broken and there were not instruments to clean anything in the kitchen. You had to be a contortionist to manouver around the bathroom. The girl on reception was icy and not helpful at all. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Poor...nothing like the pictures, smallest room ever!!”
Reviews.Author: gems_bondi04
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night last weekend and was so disappointed with the room when we arrived after being attracted by the photos. We booked a double room that was literally the size of a double bed. The 'bathroom' door wouldn't even open fully as the bed was in the way, the 'kicthen' was a cupboard with a sink and microwave in it. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom i've ever seen, i'd say if you were above average weight you wouldn't be able to turn around in the bathroom, or the shower, I struggled at 9stone! My partner and I had to brush our teeth one at a time as we both couldn't fit in. There was a gaping hole in the shower wall, no window and very dark. The hairdryer was an ancient brown plastic box mounted to the wall which wasn't even connected to the tube which blew out pathetic air. The room was ridiculously hot but the sash window didn't stay open so we had to prop it open with a wicker basket. When getting ready we had to leave the main door open just to let some air in. Nowhere to store anything, we had to do things one at a time as there just wasn't the room. Overall, the room was tiny and I can't believe we spent the Â£Â£Â£ on it, but I suppose that's London. They were renovating further down the building and i'm assuming the part we stayed in, where reception is, is yet to be done. Also, i know they always advertise their best rooms and pics on websites, but this is totally false advertising at it's best. The only positive thing is the location, about a minute walk from Earls Court tube which is on the Picadilly line for the City. Would not recommend or stay again unless paying for an apartment, but even then, I doubt they're as nice as the pics claim! Wish we'd complained but the receptionist was snotty enough! Should've just stayed on my friends floor after all!

Reviews.Title: “I book this hotel every year!”
Reviews.Author: amish440
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 24th April to 7th May and this is the 5th time I visited it. When I travel to London I always book this hotel because it has nice location, atomosphere and good price. Me personally the best point is that all rooms have a kitchenette facility so we can manage everything. A big supermarket is 5 minute-walk from here. I sometimes see customer's bad review on the net, but I guess their stories are not quite convincing. When I have a trouble or something I ask hotel staff quickly and they help me kindly every time. Earl's Court, the nearest tube station, is convenient to go to central London and also from Heathrow airport. I'll be sure to book this York house Hotel next year. Looking forward to seeing you all. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay if you want to feel really welcome! A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: FelinJonkoping
Reviews.Content: This is a prefect hotel! They really do make you feel welcome! Very nice and clean rooms! One of the best hotels I have every stayed at! I do recommend this hotel both to business travellers and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel with the friendliest staff in london”
Reviews.Author: thewrightfamily10
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the York House Hotel, our room was wonderful, the bed's were very comfortable. The decor is modern, clean and inviting. The staff were the friendliest we have experienced, they made us feel welcome and were so happy to help. You have all the conveniences at your door step, with transport less than 3 minutes walking time. When we holiday in London again we will defiantely stay at this hotel. A big thank you to all the staff for making us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Magpie92
Reviews.Content: The photos on the website were absolutely not representative of the rooms that we stayed in - completely false advertising. I've been very disappointed with our stay. Unfortunately we stayed for three nights and found poor service from staff, noisy environment, the rooms are in need of upgrade with chipped paint (and our first room had patches of wrong coloured paint everywhere), a broken bathroom 'door' (it wasn't a door, it was a cheap sliding plywood thing), crooked hanging mirrors, and the size of the 'kitchenette' is laughable. I recently stayed in an EasyHotel and would recommend that to someone (despite the tiny room size) before I recommended staying at York House Earls Court. In a word - rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: LKCW
Reviews.Content: The york House Hotel is in a very good location, right around the corner from Earl's Court Tube station. My stay was for seven nights for work experience so the price was good for the convenience. On arrival, I had to pay, there was an extra 10% added to the price (which I had not been informed of before) I would recommend using cash to pay as their chip and pin machine is faulty (it said my card was declined, but when I rang my bank, they said it had been charged) The size of the tiny room didn't bother me. It was the rooms appearance, skirting boards falling off the wall, chipped tiles in the bathroom and the door looked like it had been broken into before. The bathroom is separated by a concertina partition with handle missing on one side. I received fresh towels every morning, but the sheets were not changed once in the seven days. The phone didn't work, neither did the bedside lamp. The sockets in the Kitchenette didn't work, so I had to plug the kettle in on the floor. The carpet was grubby looking and there was a streak of paint on the wall as if it was a tester!! The ceiling in the bathroom was flaking away and looked like masking tape had been used to cover it!! When the shower is in use, everything in the bathroom gets a wash!! I'm not a hotel snob and the York House Hotel is the first hotel I have been in which I would strongly recommend against.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, not a bad place to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: KaronaMarona
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in the york house hotel, infact it was my second time staying with them. Tube station is only 1 minute walk away. It was quite clean and the staff were very friendly, although i have to say the luggage room was a little dirty. But otherwise really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay”
Reviews.Author: dishukuma80
Reviews.Content: Hi, i would like to shere my journey with u,,, I stayed here for 12 days,, it was a pleasent stay,,,i enjoyed a lot with my friends,,, and the hotel is very nice,,with huge lobby and well groomed front office staff. The rooms are neatly cleaned and tidy,, the management is very helpful and i thinks that was my best stay in london.

Reviews.Title: “Best place at the most reasonable prices: Kitchens are the best advantage”
Reviews.Author: nickzoomedup
Reviews.Content: got Teso just round the corner, saved lots of money on eating out. Very clean and tidy rooms with excellent staff and services.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Chaza86
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The carpets were filthy with dead insects over them. When we got to our room we noticed the bed sheets hadn't even been changed. we immediatly went to find somewhere else to stay. Unfortunatly it was a busy time of year. So we were forced to stay 1 night. i am amazed this hotel hasn't been closed down by health inspectors.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect much...but pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Colqy
Reviews.Content: I can only speak for myself and didn't experience any bed bugs, filthiness etc. I found the staff helpful and friendly when dealing with enquiries, and the room was clean but very small. I didn't expect much because of the cheap price paid, but can say that it was a comfortable stay on a budget. Excellent location, just round the corner from Earls Court tube station. We only wanted this hotel as a convenient hotel to sleep and we found it very useful. Very, very small (especially in the bathroom!) but if you're on a budget and don't expect luxury, then it is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 987654321Chica
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 1 week as we were working in London, and this seemed quite reasonably priced and centrally located. We booked through wotif.com where the photographs showed quite nice looking rooms. When we checked in, we were informed that we would be in one room for half the week, and switching for the last few days. I said this would not be acceptable, as we had booked for 6 nights and were working and did not want to have to change half way through our stay. They reluctantly agreed to let us stay in that room. WELL, when we were shown to my room I nearly laughed- it was nothing like the pictures on the internet, and it was a tiny dark damp room with two bare beds with old brown blankets on them, the bathroom door was a folding "curtain" door. The bed bases were bare, and the curtain was half hanging off the window. There were damp stains on the walls and broken light fittings. I complained and explained that we did not want to stay in that room, and that they had misrepresented themselves online. We were then shown to another room which had a double bed and 2 singles, was pretty shabby but an improvement on the last one, so we stayed in that one the night. In the morning, we discovered that both of us were completely covered in BED BUG bites. We packed our things and went to reception, where they told us there was nothing they could do. We called Wotif and got a refund. This hotel is staffed with liars, who try to cover up everything, and the whole place should be shut down due to environmental health. I have never been so disgusted in my life. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like sharing your room with bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Judimex
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed like a good idea at the time as it was central to where i needed to be. The price was OK for European standards. The problems was that the rooms seem to be infested with bedbugs. My daughter and i were eaten alive during our fist night there. Bites all over us. We told management and they rectified this by spraying our luggage and the bed with raid. We asked to be moved as we were there for 6 nights. The room we were moved to was smaller( if that is possible) and dark, dingy with stinky drains. The TV in the hotel may be advertised as satilight but only has 4 channels. 3 are unwatchable, religious show 24 hours a day, pop videos, nature show running 24 hours a day, same show, the other is the BBC worl news. The worse thing is that our Â¨newÂ¨ room had bugs too. We were both so badly bitten that we had to seek treatment in London from a doctor. The doctor reckoned the bugs were either in the beds, curtains or carpet. A disgrace to charge anyone or advertise when the rooms are this filthy. I suggest you do not book with these people.

Reviews.Title: “Beneath Third World Standards”
Reviews.Author: MargitPerth
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a dirty, filthy place like this. I was happy that this indian people who run this place did not serve breakfast. I would have considered this as a health hazzard. PLEASE AVOID TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL FOR ANY COSTS - YOU ARE BETTER OFF SLEEPING IN A TENT OR ON THE STREET!!!! - The pictures on the internet are misleading and do not look anything they advertise - really a big ripp off !!!! We tried to get out of this hotel as early as possible in the morning and tried to come back as late as possible - thank God that it was only for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: LIQUIFY
Reviews.Content: We had an apartment for three persons.It was not an apartment but a very small room with very small bathroom,the bathtub was ridiculous with wooden panels on side and dirty with incrustations. The worst part is that when we arrived we asked at the reception if we could pay in euros and they told yes,we paid half the first day and the rest the last day:they didn't tell us we had to pay for charges for more than 60 euros!!! Definitely avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “We regret our stay - avoid at any costs”
Reviews.Author: vladaman
Reviews.Content: We regret our stay in this hotel. There is nothing nice to write about it. They charge 5% extra for credit cards. Indian family run business with terrible service. We were not alone to complain about our service. Room was very small and stinky. Carpet was dirty, bed with terrible mattress with broken springs. Walls so thin you can hear your neighbors. When I wanted to cancel the reservation I was told no refund will be given. Please avoid at any costs. This is rip-off. Don't expect any friendly service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even for London this is very poor, grubby and tiny”
Reviews.Author: FrankPerth1
Reviews.Content: The room was really small and the layout clumsy and awkward, ensuite was ok but had a large crack across the floor and toilet ran continuously . Carpet was stained and dirty, TV useless unless standing directly in front of it, the remote did not belong to it, when mentioned to staff the response was "customers steal the remotes". As they would be useless to them perhaps it was their way of protesting about the very poor value offered. Overpriced for what it is and plenty of better options available.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with great new beds and linens.”
Reviews.Author: CaseyDallas
Reviews.Content: I must say I was a little concerned after reading the negative reviews, however; I found the hotel very lovely. The new bed was the best I have every slept on in a hotel and the new linens were beautiful. I must say, some of the Marriott's properties I haved stayed at in the U.S. were not as nice. I found the staff to be very helpful and attentive. My only concern is that the bathroom needed updating and the towels needed to be bleached as they were quite tired looking. I must say we found a wonderful restaurant about a block from the hotel. It is called the Queen's Cottage Cafe & Restaurant. The address is 235 Maida Vale. My husband & I ate there once every day for our eight day stay. All the food is good, but I especially like their pancakes. They are wonderful as is there coffee! Eveything is reasonably priced. Give them a try, I don't think you will be disappointed. If you remember when you go, tell them Dorothy from Dallas recommened them to you.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation: To avoid”
Reviews.Author: FlavioRoma
Reviews.Content: A few facts: 1 - They charge 5% more if you pay with credit card, moreover they don't accept all credit cards 2 - They ask Â£10 to let you leave the luggages in the hall the leaving day 3 - They do not serve any breakfast 4 - Rooms are dirty and incredibly small. For the same amount of money you can find a much better accomodation in the same area around Earl's Curt underground station. So my recommendation is: definitely to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: erica43
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to stayin at this hotel. From the second we arrived we were greeted with a 10 pound fee for leaving your luggage at the hotel until we could check in. Which was in 2 hours. The lady said this was the first day they were beggining to charge people so I was not advised of this on the website when I booked. The reason being the storeroom was not big enough. even though the storeroom was at least twice the size as the room we got put in and had plenty of room to store luggage. Our room was very small. Just enough room for the bed. No luggage room, couldnt open the bathroom door as the bed was in the way. The bathroom was the size of a public tolilet cubicle. The sink was over the toliet. If i wasnt small i dont know how a larger person would even fit in the bathroom. The tv was hangin on a high wall as there was no where else to put it. The kitchenette was in a cupboard where the bowls and utensils had not being cleaned and the power switch would not work so could not use the kettle. Paying a large price for this hotel as it was last minute, i would had being happier in a cheap hostel. It is not the luxury studio apartments they advertise on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrifying”
Reviews.Author: Alittlebitofthat
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room; it was wedged somewhere between the 3rd and 2nd floor. Bathroom door was a plastic foldable one that looked like it had been recovered from a garbage dump; the entire room smells SO BAD that i couldn't sleep at all the first night, moved out the next day and had to pay an extra night's penalty. Carpet was COVERED with a layer of other people's hairs, like a second layer of carpet! What bothered me was that what could have been fixed very easily was not, such as the falling down lightbulb (not lamp--lightbulb) in the bathroom, which was taped back to the ceiling with tape!--the incompletely painted wall (looked like somebody painted 4/5 of the wall, and then just stopped). Shower and toilet were absolutely grimey. Honestly, I could not believe my eyes. This was how horrible this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Credit Card Charges”
Reviews.Author: oldtowncavan
Reviews.Content: Please be aware that on arrival if you choose to pay by credit card you will be charged 5% extra. As a single female traveller who did not want to walk to an ATM for cash late at night, that left me with no choice. So bring cash, and have a cup of coffe with your 5% :(

Reviews.Title: “unorthodox way to find good hotels”
Reviews.Author: john20012009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoy staying in the York hotel in London and we highly recommend it we booked our vaction ourselves and saved lots of money that way As for information about hotels all i can say is that i (usually!) put my trust in .info sites as a source of reliable information for example google (or any other big search service) search in the following format will provide you with lots of information about the hotel you are interesting in "York London Hotel site:*.info" hope this helps and i am sure you will have a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: globetrotergrl04
Reviews.Content: My stay in York House was enjoyable. I stayed in double ensuite. Being from America I knew that the room would not be that large. Everything in London is on a much smaller level. However, the room was clean and cozy. The bathroom was very nice, and the it was nice to have a kitchenette for me to cook breakfast. York House looked new as if it had just recently been refurbished. The staff was friendly and helpful. They made sure my stay was comfortable so that I could enjoy my time in London. It was also convenient that there was a lift so I did not have to carry my luggage up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch...that's itchy”
Reviews.Author: shawzam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through www.easytobook.com. The few reviews did not seem bad. This website advertises them to include breakfast. This is not the case, they do not even serve breakfast. We had to pay cash in full for the 3 nights prior to check-in. The room smelled stale, probably from the filthy stained carpet & burnt drapes. Luckily the window opens fully and does not lock (so don't leave valuables in room). There wasn't even coffee or tea offered (like all other hotels). The makeshift bathroom door has screws protruding half an inch which scratched my girlfriend's arm in the middle of the night. The towels were thin & coarse, obviously overused. One side of the bed was worn out. This place is so close to the underground, you can actually feel it coming & going, let alone hear it. AND to top it all off, we left with souvenirs; BED BUG BITES! Wish we had spent the extra 10 pounds & stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Run-don't walk--from this hellhole”
Reviews.Author: GuteReise123
Reviews.Content: The lobby looked nice enough--and it was the ONLY thing about the entire hotel that you can tell the ownder paid any attention to. I booked a single room--the room was tiny, but that was the best part of my stay. The paint on the wall looks like it's halfway through construction, mostly white with some random red patch on the side. As soon as i walked into the room i noticed it smelled--not like mold, not like someone's old cooking (there was a kitchentte in the room), but like a ROTTING DEAD ANIMAL(i know what it smells like; i've smelled one before.). The bathroom door is foldable, plastic one, that like the rest of the furnishings inside the hotel room, screams the CHEAPEST kind one can get ANYWHERE (ones that almost seem disposable, almost.) I booked the hotel for 8 nights; the first night i got there, i knelt down on the floor to get something; later i was sitting on my bed to watch the TV--when all of a sudden i noticed the many, many blonde hairs stuck to my pajama pants (I have black hair.). I climbed out of my bed, and looked closely at the carpet--Honestly, i have NO IDEA when the last time the maid vacuumed was; it was covered with someone else's hairs. That was not the worst part. During the night i kept smelling that dead animal rotting odor and COULD NOT FALL ASLEEP the ENTIRE NIGHT. I couldn't get another room because, amazingly, this hotel from HELL was actually FULL. Summary of York House Hotel: 1) The SHOCKING drastic difference in cleanliness, maintenance, and decoration between its front door lobby and actual rooms screams DECEIT by the hotel owner; 2) You can tell by the HORRIFYING level of uncleanliness, the bathroom lights that are actually TAPED to the bathroom ceiling to keep them from falling down, the choice of the CHEAPEST POSSIBLE APPLIANCES anywhere in the hotel--the kind that you get at 99cent stores--that York House does NOT give ONE OUNCE of concern, for its customers' actual wellbeing. If you ask me, these are greedy, unconscienable money suckers that take advantage of clueless tourists/out of towners that really when they get here, because of their limited time, resources and knowledge about the area, are likely not to be able to do too much about their treatment. These are not honest, upstanding businessmen running the hotel. So unless you WANT to become the next victim, RUN--DON'T WALK--from York House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wish I had read this reviews before as terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Thomas099
Reviews.Content: I have been in that hotel a few years ago and reading these reviews now, I can notice that nothing has changed. I had booked this place thanks to a recommendation of the Lonely Planet (God knows why they listed this hotel). I booked a room for my family but when I went there to see the room I was so disappointed that I decided that I couldn't have relatives to stay there. Even if I had booked a while before and wanted to cancel my reservation two months before, my deposit of Â£80 was kept. Such a rip-off! I can just agree with other travellers: to avoid at any costs.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: Fnuff
Reviews.Content: My and a male friend were heading down to London for an audition, so decided to share a room so we could rehearse the night before. We'd booked a twin room only to be told when we arrived that they had put us in a double room as they had run out of twin rooms!!! So we said that was unacceptable and we were offered a single room & a double room. So we first went to check out the double...only fit for someone under 5ft tall! The bed was tiny, there was no space between the toilet & the walls and the bathroom was like a dungeon - you had to step down into it & it was dark & the light fitting was hanging off the ceiling! So we then ventured to to the bottom floor (in the cellar) to the double room...only to find that unless you slammed the door with great force, it didn't shut/lock properly! Then we noticed the smell...foisty & damp, the bathroom had an arched ceiling & again was really only fit for someone smaller than maybe 5'5" - and the shower was as high as it would go at about 5'1"!! I then sat on the bed to decide whether to complain about the damp smell & realised that the bed covers were damp...so back up to reception. I was then given a key for room 2 - not an electronic key like the other rooms but an actual key, the receptionist led me out front to what I can only describe as an outhouse! Because of needing somewhere to stay I just accepted it as it wasn't damp. The bathroom was also again very very low and as my friend was 6ft 2" he wasn't going to have a comfortable shower in any of the rooms! I then realised there was no kitchenette, wardrobe, microwave, tea/coffee facilities or for that matter anything else that was supposed to be in every room! But I had theatre tickets & was in a rush to get out so couldn't do anything about it! When I got back there to sleep later on - I then couldn't sleep as there was a very loud whirring noise that I thought was coming from the radiator, so I turned it off at the switch only for the noise to continue all night long. So a crap room and a crap sleep was had by me! I was disgusted with the service I received & the way the receptionist spoke to me. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone not even my worst enemy. Just AWFUL from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Staggering Levels of Awful”
Reviews.Author: Inkmonkey
Reviews.Content: Myself and a colleague booked one-night's stay here whilst we attended a conference nearby. Given that we were on a budget, we booked - and confirmed - a twin room. So when we arrived and were shown a box-sized double room (and barely that, the double bed was tiny) somewhere in the depths of the basement, needless to say we were unimpressed. Thinking there had been a simple clerical error we attempted to find the source of the problem and get another room. Well...this is where simple bad communication and customer service became Fawlty Towers level ineptitude and bufoonery. We were informed that no other rooms were available and that, anyway, the hotel reserved the right to provide rooms for guests that were different from those booked and confirmed. When we tried to argue the point they just held the line that, despite confirming a twin room for us, they were perfectly within their rights to swap it for another without telling us if they wanted to do that. We checked out on the spot and were lucky enough to find a genuinely good hotel round the corner - one that provided a generous suite and superb breakfast (which we wouldn't have gotten at the York) for only Â£15 more than we had paid at the York. In conclusion - I would not recommend this hotel to ANYONE. Aside from being exceedingly cramped and failing to provide services they claim they do (there is no Internet access no matter what they tell you...) the staff display incredible levels of arrogance and stupidty when confronted about their total lack of service and inability to honour their promises! Avoid this awful place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Needless to say we didn't stay there any longer than 5 minutes...”
Reviews.Author: squarecat
Reviews.Content: Arriving before check-in we left our bags and double checked the room type - a twin for our business trip to Earl's Court. All confirmed until we turned up later, and after the person on reception had actually charged my card (without any mention of what was to come) we went into the basement to find a room about 1 ft each way larger than the DOUBLE bed in the room. Apparently this hotel reserves the right to change a twin to a double or vice versa. I presume depending on the whim of the reception. Following a small altercation I got my money refunded - popped into Starbucks, and booked a far superior hotel - Hotel Amsterdam, just around the corner. A far throw from the ineptitude of the York Hotel. Thank god we didn't have to stay at the York Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and nasty..”
Reviews.Author: JenL23
Reviews.Content: Can't agree more with the other poor reviews. we booked a triple room but upon arriving this room was 'unavailable' and was instead given 2 double rooms for 3 of us in the basement. Whilst we trekked through the narrow winding corridors there is an awful smell of damp. One room was ok-ish, apart from holes in the wall, plaster/wallpaper falling off etc, but the other was so hot and stuffy and we had to request a fan to cool the room down ( the window couldn't be opened!) the bathroom doors are a joke, sliding, corrugated plastic doors that don't even close properly! the rooms were tiny, and nowhere to move! our tv had no reception/wasn't connected, the other tv had one foreign channel! only good thing was location to the tube station and the power shower which was only hot on the 2nd shower in the morning! Don't stay!!

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: curvyjones
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel easy enough, literally just around the corner from Earls Court tube station. From the outside I thought it looked okay and once inside the reception area it looked ok. I stayed in room 12 on the ground floor almost in the reception area it was that close. Got into the room and I was well disappointed. You could tell it had once been a very large room that had been divided into 3 rooms. There was no room to swing a cat. You could not even walk around the bed. Inside the room was a desk that one would use to put their PC on, a tall cupboard with no hangers, and a mirror on the wall. Utensils: An extremely large kettle, one cup, one bowl, one glass and some cutlery, not very good if there are two of you! There was a TV on the wall that had two channels one in french one in spanish. The bathroom was an ok size but there were no towells and the shower desperately leaked. When I booked the hotel it said there was internet in the rooms which I needed for work, however when I asked they said there was no internet at the minute as they were sorting things out with a new provider, BUT I was welcome to use the one in the tiny reception area for Â£1 for fifteen minutes, work that one out? No breakfast either. Defo wont be staying there again. Cost for one night Â£55 for the room

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely To Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: alicia75
Reviews.Content: Very small room (impossible to stay for 2 people!), dirty. We had to stay in the underground floor.The bathroom (shower directly on the ground) has never been cleaned in 5 days. The only window of the room was locked and although we asked for the key to open it several times we did not get it. So we've been locked in for 5 days and the bathroom had no air out machine... The breakfast is served in your room and there is a little kitchnette (but the microwave owen didn't work): this means that at night you find in your refrigerator milk and a couple of orange juice, and that you have to wash the dishes yourself (without soap!). If you want to pay by credit card they charge you 5% of the total. The category should be * and not *** !

Reviews.Title: “See if I come here again”
Reviews.Author: JanetDi
Reviews.Content: As our first choice hotel was fully booked for our dates of travel, we decided on this one, of similar price and in the same area, which is well known to us. We were a bit disappointed that it was more expensive than our first choice AND breakfast was not included, but not wanting to go to another altogether unfamiliar part of London, we took it anyway. The first impression was quite good: a nice, clean reception, professional-looking, though it soon became quite clear that one of the receptionists was new. Checkin went quite slow, also because her English wasn't all that clear, but you know, new job, we've all been there. And anyway, we were on holiday, so it's not like we were in a rush. The lift was not working, so we had to climb the stairs to our room on the second floor, where we encountered our first obstacle: the keycard didn't work. Well, it did eventually, but only after about 5,000 tries. We were a tad annoyed about that, but we let it go. Don't want to start complaining after 5 minutes of being here. The room, on first glance, looked okay. Very small, but being budget travellers, we're sort of used to that. We did notice on closer inspection that the plastic cover had fallen off the fire alarm, and that the front of the bath had come off exposing the wooden board behind. All the curtains were closed when we came in, and it being a rare sunny day in January, Di decided to open them and look out. Big mistake. As soon as she gave the curtain a pull, the rail came off the ceiling! The room being quite high, and we being quite short, we couldn't put it back up, so we told the receptionist "the curtain has fallen down" and she promised to have someone in to fix it for us. However, when we came back that evening after a visit to the theatre, it was to find that only the fire alarm had been fixed, but the curtain was still crumpled on the carpet as when we left. Clearly someone had been in, and I wonder how they could possibly have missed that. Anyway, it being quite late, we decided to leave it for the moment, even though our window turned out to be right in front of a street light so that we didn't sleep much. On our first morning in this hotel we woke up stiff and cold, because the blankets were really quite thin. When trying to make tea in the little kitchenette, we soon figured out that there was no power to the socket where we were supposed to plug the kettle in. We put the kettle on the nightstand and plugged it in there, where it did work. Also, we had to test the little cups of milk in the fridge in a glass of water first, as some were past their sell-by date. When we came back from a brilliant day in London, we found our curtain still on the floor, even though the maid had been in and must have noticed it as well. When Di wanted to go for a shower it turned out that our used (and still wet!) towels had simply been picked up off the floor and folded up again! So, yeah, not much good to be said about this place. The staff are very friendly even though they don't actually solve your problems, and try to be helpful with questions about London transport and so on. But if you want (more) value for your money, we do suggest trying your luck elsewhere. There are a lot more of these kinds of hotels in London that are cheaper and do offer you breakfast, and may even have rooms that don't fall apart. Janet & Di

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Run Away Fast!!!”
Reviews.Author: alnueman1
Reviews.Content: Planned on spending 4 days at the York during Christmas, but was truly shocked once we saw the rooms. Rooms were dirty, falling apart, smelled bad, and incredibly small. I can handle small, but when there are hairs in your bed, bugs stuck to the windows, and items falling off of the walls - it is a serious sign for concern. After 45 mins with the general manager, we left the York to check into a much nicer, and cleaner, hotel. We said there were hairs in our blankets and sheets and the manager offered to change them for us. Weren't they supposed to be changed before we got there?? Plus, I have heard that they have raised their rates from the 52 pounds we booked at.... I have stayed in at 20 rooms all over Europe and have never, never seen anything this bad before. If you have reservations, seroiusly consider something else.... its not too late!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: cailin_donn
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed after reading some good reviews here. The sizes of our rooms used as singles rooms were ok - small but sufficient. Would have been much too small for a couple though. The rooms were clean only at first sight - a lot of dust and some of the dishes and cutlery provided were still dirty. The staff were completely helpless with any problems occurring - they weren't even able to issue receipts for our payments. The worst thing was though that the heating failed (it was December and quite cold) and nothing could be done about it until January!!! My friend got quite ill afterwards because of the freezing cold and had to leave earlier than planned. Although the hotel has been very cheap for London we certainly wouldn't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: trs62
Reviews.Content: Most of the things stated on their homesite is not true: Definintly not a three star hotel, a most a two star! Not newly furnished, in fact its a worn-down hotel in dire need of a total renovation. The rooms are very small and crowded Hotel has no restaurang, there is a small breakfast room in the basement, which you can get to by using the tiny elevator. Room smelled of mould, had to sleep with open windows to stand it. Telephone didnt work, toilette is leaking water, then taking a shower, water is running into the hotelroom soaking the floorcarpet with water Staff is indifferent to complaints, downright rude. Management dont care. Summary: If YorkHotel cant take care of their customers, someone else will! Never again this dump!

Reviews.Title: “A total Shocker! Only hotel I have ever walked out of!”
Reviews.Author: JudgementDay
Reviews.Content: The Hotel from hell! Definitely one to be avoided! Filthy dirty, dirty bed linen, dirty carpets, dirty walls. Single lift in hotel was not working. Room was full of flies and other insects. I am well travelled and have stayed at more than 400 hotels around the world. I booked for 4 nights and stayed for one, only because it was too late to get another holel that night (although I tried for 3 hours to find one!) Hotel is not worthy of one star!

Reviews.Title: “Handicapped”
Reviews.Author: Boardgamer
Reviews.Content: Every year in the last week of January we, my wife and I, visit the Toy Fair in London, being a family board games collector the annual Toy Fair at ExCel is a must. A couple of years we found out that my wife suffers from Multiple Sclerosis and has problems with her balance. She now uses a so called â€œrollatorâ€� i.e. a walking aid on wheels, not a wheelchair. For our purpose we were looking for a hotel suitable for handicapped people. To store the medication for my wife the hotel had to have a private fridge as well. In the available Dutch brochures the only one we found was York Hotel. The hotel is situated in our favourite area, Earlâ€™s Court, shops, restaurants and the busstops nearby. (I mention busstops specificly, despite the fact that Earlâ€™s Court Underground Station is wheelchair-friendly - I checked it personnally - and as long as not every Underground Station is wheelchair-friendly, weâ€™ll use the busses.
